BERTS2S: an edinburgh taxi driver who took thousands of people to a festival has revealed he has been given the chance to take up the art exhibition.
BERTS2S_lines: an edinburgh taxi driver who took thousands of people to a festival has revealed he has been given the chance to take up the art exhibition.
TConvS2S: a scottish man has told a court how he was ``the best person in the world\'\'as he walked out of the edinburgh festival.
TConvS2S_lines: a scottish man has told a court how he was ``the best person in the world\'\'as he walked out of the edinburgh festival.
PtGen: a taxi driver who took photographs of a hen party in scotland has been described as a ``hen party\'\'.
PtGen_lines: a taxi driver who took photographs of a hen party in scotland has been described as a ``hen party\'\'.
TranS2S: a teacher from edinburgh who was found with head injuries on a taxi has told a court he " didn\'t expect to pull out ".
TranS2S_lines: a teacher from edinburgh who was found with head injuries on a taxi has told a court he " didn\'t expect to pull out ".
article: Ryan Walls took pictures of 101 passengers during the Edinburgh Festival in 2015.The 42-year-old said only two people refused out of the 103 people he asked due to being in a hurry and having a bad hair day.Now the father-of-three's pictures will go on display at Out of the Blue Drill Hall, Dalmeny Street, in August.Mr Walls told the BBC Scotland news website how he took photographs of a hen party, stag do, football fans, a chef, a high court judge and a TV agony aunt from Kuwait.He said: "Everyone was so nice. One of the pictures is of a passenger who was in such a hurry that he couldn't wait for another taxi when I discovered the central locking system was broken so I had to pull him in and out of the taxi window."I also had an elderly former English teacher who had suddenly decided she wanted to go out to a show at the festival at the last minute and she had lots of words of encouragement for me so I really enjoyed chatting with her."I also got a Jambo fan and was worried I wasn't going to get a Hibs fan but luckily I did."I'm really interested in people and wanted to capture that moment in my cab, I only had seconds to take a few pictures and I'm really pleased with the end result."The exhibition runs from 31 July until 5 August.
article_lines: Ryan Walls took pictures of 101 passengers during the Edinburgh Festival in 2015.The 42-year-old said only two people refused out of the 103 people he asked due to being in a hurry and having a bad hair day.
Now the father-of-three's pictures will go on display at Out of the Blue Drill Hall, Dalmeny Street, in August.
Mr Walls told the BBC Scotland news website how he took photographs of a hen party, stag do, football fans, a chef, a high court judge and a TV agony aunt from Kuwait.
One of the pictures is of a passenger who was in such a hurry that he couldn't wait for another taxi when I discovered the central locking system was broken
so I had to pull him in and out of the taxi window.
"I also had an elderly former English teacher who had suddenly decided she wanted to go out to a show at the festival at the last minute
and she had lots of words of encouragement for me
so I really enjoyed chatting with her.
"I also got a Jambo fan and was worried I wasn't going to get a Hibs fan
really interested in people and wanted to capture that moment in my cab, I only had seconds to take a few pictures
and I'm really pleased with the end result.
exhibition runs from 31 July until 5 August.
traps: ryan walls took pictures of 101 passengers during the edinburgh festival in 2015.the 42-year-old said only two people refused out of the 103 people he asked due to being in a hurry and having a bad hair day.
he said : " everyone was not so nice .

reference: an edinburgh taxi driver has created an exhibition and book from pictures he has taken of passengers in his cab.
